crawler, a rhythm dancing game, a trading card game, four manga series, two animated series, a feature film, and a light novel. Some of these titles crossover with characters from Persona 3 as well.","description":"

Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 4<\/em> was originally intended to be that last installment of the Persona<\/em> franchise, which is itself a spinoff from the larger Shin Megami Tensei<\/em> family. However, critical acclaim and steady sales influenced Atlus<\/a> to collaborate with Arc System Works Co., Ltd.<\/a> to spinoff the series into a fighting game, Persona 4 the Ultimate in Mayonaka Aren<\/em>a (known as Persona 4: Arena<\/em> in the West). The title notably shed the \"Shin Megami Tensei\"<\/em> prefix, as would all future installments in the franchise, indicating that Persona<\/em> and Shin Megami Tensei<\/em> were to be treated as separate entities.<\/p>

In 2011, to coincide with the timeline of the original game, Atlus commissioned AIC ASTA to adapt the story into a 25-episode anime. The series was well-received upon release. Parts of key episodes were edited into a feature film and released theatrically.<\/p>

With the launch of the PlayStation Vita, Atlus remastered Persona 4<\/em> as Persona 4: the Golden, <\/em>with updated visuals, several gameplay improvements, and additional story content.In addition to being the best-reviewed game on the platform, Golden<\/em> sold over 1 million units, making it the best-selling Atlus JRPG of all time.<\/p>

The major success of Golden<\/em> prompted Atlus to spinoff the series further, beginning work on a sequel to the Ultimate<\/em> - Persona: 4 the Ultimax Ultra Suplex Hold<\/em> (localized as Persona 4: Arena Ultimax<\/em>) - a first-person dungeon crawler for the Nintendo 3DS - Persona Q: Shadow of the Labyrinth<\/em> - and a rhythm dancing game - Persona 4: Dancing All Night<\/em>. With the exception of Persona Q<\/em>, the events depicted in each spinoff are canonical. Each title takes place in the time between the True Ending of Persona 4<\/em> and the epilogue at the end of Golden<\/em>, with Dancing All Night <\/em>serving as the final adventure for the Investigation Team.<\/em><\/p>

Atlus also tapped A-1 Pictures to adapted the Golden<\/em> in Persona 4: the Golden Animation<\/em>. A manga series retelling the events of the original game, the Ultimate<\/em>, and Persona Q<\/em> were also released, as well as a light novel\/manga extending the story of Naoto Shirogane, Persona x Detective Naoto<\/em>.<\/p>","games":[{"api_detail_url":"https:\/\/www.giantbomb.com\/api\/game\/3030-44565\/","id":44565,"name":"Persona 4: Dancing All
